meanings.definition: A code of letters and digits used to identify a specific area for mail delivery.
meanings.sent1: The postcode on the letter helped the mail carrier deliver it to the right house.
meanings.sent2: I always double-check the postcode before sending a package to avoid any delays.
meanings.sent3: The postcode on the envelope played hide-and-seek with the postman.
meanings.sent4: Her postcode was like a secret key that unlocked the door to her home.
meanings.sent5: The postcode acted as a map, guiding the letter to its destination.

meanings.definition: To assign a postcode to a specific address.
meanings.sent1: The post office will postcode the new neighborhood next week.
meanings.sent2: Remember to postcode each letter before dropping them off at the mailbox.
meanings.sent3: He decided to postcode his friend's treehouse for fun.
meanings.sent4: She will postcode the packages with care to ensure they reach the right recipients.
meanings.sent5: The company will postcode all the buildings in the area for efficient mail delivery.
